Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal document on recto (11 ll., part of the text is missing on the left-hand side) and verso (list of 16 witnesses) dated Paophi of year 24 of Ptolemy III Euergetes I. Sale of half of house and courtyard at Hermonthis. The Greek Melas son of Apollonios sells to his wife Senobastis daughter of Ptolemaios half of a house and courtyard at Armant (Hermonthis). Scribe Herieus the elder son of Harsiesis.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.82-3, pl.68, 70)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2735) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2735)
